```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(mice)
```

```{r}
sd <- readRDS(file = "./data/clean_soil_data.rds")
```

## MICE
```{r}
round(mean(is.na(sd))*100, 2)
```
Twelve percent of this data is missing. 

```{r}
imp_sd <- mice(sd, m=30, maxit=25, seed=500, printFlag=FALSE)
summary(imp_sd)
```

```{r}
imp_sd$meth
```

```{r}
plot(imp_sd)
```


```{r}
# with() use the imputed data set and run the model on every imputation (m=30)
model <- with(imp_sd, lm(ExchNa_ppm ~ Year + Irr_season + Field_ID + Soil_pH + Soluble_Salts + NO3_D1_ppm + Bicarb_P_ppm + SO4_ppm + ExchK_ppm + ExchCa_ppm + ExchMg_ppm + Zn_ppm + Mn_ppm + Cu_ppm + Boron_ppm + CEC_me_100g + treatment))

## pool() calculate pooled estimates using rubin's rules. 
mi.estimates <- summary(pool(model))

kable(pool(model)$pooled[c(1:4,8:9)], digits=3)
```

```{r}
complete.model <- lm(ExchNa_ppm ~ Year + Irr_season + Field_ID + Soil_pH + Soluble_Salts + NO3_D1_ppm + Bicarb_P_ppm + SO4_ppm + ExchK_ppm + ExchCa_ppm + ExchMg_ppm + Zn_ppm + Mn_ppm + Cu_ppm + Boron_ppm + CEC_me_100g + treatment, data = sd)



betas <- coef(complete.model)
ci <- confint(complete.model)


```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(forestplot)
## complete case (cc) multiple imputation (mi)
cc.mean <- betas
mi.mean <- mi.estimates[,2]
cc.ll   <- te.mean - 1.96*summary(complete.model)$coefficients[,2]
mi.ll   <- mi.mean - 1.96*summary(pool(model))[,2]
cc.ul   <- te.mean + 1.96*summary(complete.model)$coefficients[,2]
mi.ul   <- mi.mean + 1.96*summary(pool(model))[,2]
names   <- names(coef(complete.model))


forestplot(names, 
           legend = c("True Model", "MICE"),
           fn.ci_norm = c(fpDrawNormalCI, fpDrawCircleCI), 
           mean = cbind(te.mean, mi.mean), 
           lower = cbind(te.ll, mi.ll),
           upper = cbind(te.ul, mi.ul), 
           col=fpColors(box=c("blue", "darkred")), 
           xlab="Regression coefficients",
           boxsize = .1
           )
```


```{r}
sd_imp <- complete(imp_sd, action=25)
sd_imp_long <- complete(imp_sd, 'long')
```

```{r}
names(sd_imp_long)
```


